qas.question: Who was a notable chief of the Miami police?
To what controversial organization did a Miami chief of police belong?
For what reason did H. Leslie Quigg kill a black man?

answers.text: speaking directly to a white woman

qas.question: What was the occupation of the African-American man killed by Quigg?
Who was a unnotable chief of the Miami police?
Who was a notable constable of the Miami police?
To what controversial organization didn't a Miami chief of police belong?

plausible_answers.text: for speaking directly to a white woman

qas.question: For what reason did H. Leslie Quigg save a black man?
What was the occupation of the African-American woman killed by Quigg?

context: During the early 20th century, northerners were attracted to the city, and Miami prospered during the 1920s with an increase in population and infrastructure. The legacy of Jim Crow was embedded in these developments. Miami's chief of police, <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>H. Leslie Quigg<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/>, did not hide the fact that he, like many other white Miami police officers, was a member of the <a1_0><b6_0>Ku Klux Klan<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Unsurprisingly, these officers enforced social codes far beyond the written law. Quigg, for example, "personally and publicly beat a colored <a3_0><b8_0>bellboy<b8_0/><a3_0/> to death <b7_0>for <a2_0>speaking directly to a white woman<b7_0/><a2_0/>."
